item.title: Implementation of Tariffs on Goods from Canada to Address Drug Trafficking Issues
item.description: This executive order implements an additional 25% tariff on goods from Canada, due to concerns over the influx of illicit drugs like fentanyl into the U.S. The order cites Canada's insufficient action against drug trafficking organizations and aims to enhance cooperation in addressing the public health crisis caused by these drugs. The new tariff rates will take effect on February 4, 2025, with provisions for adjustments based on U.S.-Canada cooperation.

item.title: Review of Aviation Safety and Hiring Practices
item.description: This memorandum instructs the Secretary of Transportation and the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration to assess recent hiring decisions and safety protocols to ensure they meet established aviation safety standards, with a focus on reinstating merit-based recruitment practices.

item.title: Executive Order on Additional Measures to Combat Anti-Semitism
item.description: This executive order reaffirms and expands upon previous actions to combat anti-Semitism in the United States, particularly in educational settings. It requires federal agencies to report on measures to address anti-Semitic harassment and violence, including an analysis of related civil rights complaints and legal enforcement actions. The order emphasizes a commitment to protect Jewish students and ensure all federal resources are utilized to address acts of anti-Semitism.

item.title: Laken Riley Act
item.description: The Laken Riley Act mandates the Secretary of Homeland Security to detain individuals who have been charged with theft in the United States.

item.title: Expansion of Migrant Operations Center at Naval Station Guantanamo Bay
item.description: This memorandum directs the expansion of the Migrant Operations Center at Naval Station Guantanamo Bay to increase detention capacity for certain undocumented individuals and to support immigration enforcement efforts.

item.title: Establishment of Task Force for America's 250th Anniversary Celebration
item.description: This executive order establishes the White House Task Force on Celebrating America's 250th Birthday to plan nationwide celebrations for the July 4, 2026 anniversary. The Task Force will involve key federal officials and coordinate efforts to honor American history while reinstating certain previous executive orders related to monuments and historical figures.

item.title: Executive Order on K-12 Education Guidelines and Parental Rights
item.description: This executive order outlines the administration's policies aimed at addressing perceived ideological indoctrination in K-12 education, with a focus on protecting parental rights and ensuring compliance with existing anti-discrimination laws. It emphasizes the creation of an 'Ending Indoctrination Strategy' to eliminate federal funding for educational practices that it considers discriminatory or damaging to students, while also reestablishing the President's Advisory 1776 Commission to promote patriotic education.

item.title: Executive Order on Expanding Educational Choice and Opportunities
item.description: This executive order aims to enhance parental choice in education by supporting K-12 educational alternatives. It directs the Secretary of Education to provide guidance on using federal funds for educational choice initiatives, encourages education freedom through discretionary grants, and outlines plans to assist families, including military and low-income families, in accessing alternative education options. Reviews will be conducted to identify mechanisms for utilizing federal funding to expand these opportunities by the 2025-26 school year.

item.title: Executive Order on Medical Interventions for Minors
item.description: This executive order establishes a federal policy to prohibit funding or support for medical procedures related to gender transition for individuals under 19. It requires review and amendment of existing policies relying on specific medical guidance and aims to exclude related procedures from federal health coverage and insurance plans.

item.title: Reinstatement of Military Personnel Discharged Due to COVID-19 Vaccine Mandate
item.description: This order enables the reinstatement of military personnel who were discharged for refusing the COVID-19 vaccine. It mandates that they be restored to their former rank and receive back pay and benefits, alongside provisions for those who voluntarily left service under similar circumstances.
